comments.author: Ucy
comments.body: Quote from: maudo on February 24, 2023, 08:30:42 AMwell im planing to keep my other dekstop for light works, but i cannot decide which one cpu is better? mini dekstop pc with 256nvme , 16gb ddr4, and i5 6500t cpu ? or small laptop with all the same specs just cpu ryzen 2500u?Thank you for you replies !Edit:Mostly ill use that pc for VMware with virtual pc's and chrome with 80+tabsDepends on you. If both handle the heavy works really well then you could choose between them which to use mostly for light work... while the other mostly for heavy works. This could depend on different factors: *Which do you want to be more mobile or stationary *How often do you want to use them*How much energy do both consume *etcIf it's something you want to use regularly, you are concerned about how much energy both consume and you want something for mobility then go for the laptop... Otherwise you may stick to the desktop. People typically use desktop for heavy work while laptop are typically used for light work but lots of laptops have become as capable as desktop even though they are smaller. However i have noticed that desktop can still be more powerful than laptop of thesame specs. So you really have to be sure. You may even test how powerful both are via websites that do that kind of testing. But I'm not sure how reliable such tests are.
